qas.question: Who did Gaddafi accuse the Libyan rebels of being linked to?
How many protesters were killed in Benghazi?
What rebel organization was founded in Benghazi?
Cities in what geographic part of Libya were controlled by rebels?
Along with Benghazi and Misrata, what cities did the rebels control in February?

context: Accusing the rebels of being "drugged" and linked to <a0_0>al-Qaeda<a0_0/>, Gaddafi proclaimed that he would die a martyr rather than leave Libya. As he announced that the rebels would be "hunted down street by street, house by house and wardrobe by wardrobe", the army opened fire on protests in Benghazi, killing <a1_0>hundreds<a1_0/>. Shocked at the government's response, a number of senior politicians resigned or defected to the protesters' side. The uprising spread quickly through Libya's less economically developed <a3_0>eastern<a3_0/> half. By February's end, eastern cities like Benghazi, Misrata, <a4_0>al-Bayda and Tobruk<a4_0/> were controlled by rebels, and the Benghazi-based <a2_0>National Transitional Council<a2_0/> (NTC) had been founded to represent them.
